home.content: PHOTO TIME - A self-photography studio in Korean style, a cultural trend that is being loved and chosen by most Vietnamese youth. At PHOTO TIME, we are not just a photo studio but also a place that brings you endless joy and preserves personal memorable moments. Currently, PHOTO TIME has 14 branches in major cities: Ho Chi Minh, Hanoi, Nghe An, and we will continue to expand our store system in the near future.

content.download: Scan QR code and download photos

footer.address: 39 Nguyen Gia Tri, 25 Ward, Binh Thanh District, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

required.name: Name is required
required.policyAgreement: You must agree to the policy for collecting and using personal information

modal.title: Privacy Policy
modal.content1:
Purpose of Collecting and Using Personal Information

1. Provide information to answer questions about the service, fulfill service contracts, and provide service content

2. Develop new services and provide specialized content

Methods and Items of Personal Information Collected

1. Items of personal information collected

1.1. The company collects the following personal information for service applications, etc.

*********Required Items*********
modal.content2:
• Company name, contact person, contact information, email

1.2. Information that may be automatically created and collected during the use of the service or business processing.
modal.content3:
Access information IP, cookie, access log

2. Methods of collecting personal information

• Request consultation for production through the website

Retention and Use Period of Personal Information
modal.content4: In principle, the user's personal information will be destroyed immediately after achieving the purpose of collecting and using the personal information. However, if retention is required by law or relevant regulations, the company will retain member information for a certain period as specified by the relevant laws and regulations.
modal.content5:
1. Reasons for retention according to the company's internal policies

1.1 Retention period of personal information when registering as a member.

• Reason for retention: Identify individuals and prevent unauthorized use

• Retention period: 5 years
modal.content6:
1.2 Retention period of personal information when withdrawing membership.

• Reason for retention: Prevent unauthorized use

• Retention period: 1 year
modal.content7:
2. Reasons for retention according to relevant laws and regulations

If retention is necessary according to relevant laws, such as the Commercial Act and the Act on Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, the company will store member information for a certain period as specified by the relevant laws. In this case, the company uses the stored information only for the purpose of storage and the retention period as follows.
modal.content8:
2.1. Records on contracts or withdrawal of subscriptions, etc.

• Reason for retention: Act on Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce

• Retention period: 5 years
modal.content9:
2.2. Records on payment and supply of goods, etc.

• Reason for retention: Act on Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce

• Retention period: 5 years
modal.content10:
2.3. Records on electronic financial transactions

• Reason for retention: Electronic Financial Transactions Act

• Retention period: 5 years
modal.content11:
2.4. Records on consumer complaints or dispute resolution

• Reason for retention: Act on Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce

• Retention period: 3 years
modal.content12:
2.5. Records related to identity verification

• Reason for retention: Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection

• Retention period: 1 year
modal.content13:
2.6. Records of visits

• Reason for retention: Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection

• Retention period: 3 months

*********Additional Clauses*********
modal.content14:
These terms and conditions were amended on July 1, 2024.

These terms and conditions will take effect from July 1, 2024.
